verses.kjv: Now Jericho was straitly shut up because of the children of Israel: none went out, and none came in.
verses.web: Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel. No one went out, and no one came in.
verses.ct: Jericho was completely locked down because of the Israelites. No one went out, and no one came in.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, See, I have given into thine hand Jericho, and the king thereof, and the mighty men of valour.
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Behold, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and the mighty men of valor.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Joshua, "Look — I have already handed Jericho over to you, along with its king and its strongest warriors.

verses.kjv: And ye shall compass the city, all ye men of war, and go round about the city once. Thus shalt thou do six days.
verses.web: All of your men of war shall march around the city, going around the city once. You shall do this six days.
verses.ct: Have all your fighting men march around the city once. Do this for 6 days.

verses.kjv: And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams’ horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow with the trumpets.
verses.web: Seven priests shall bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark. On the seventh day, you shall march around the city seven times, and the priests shall blow the trumpets.
verses.ct: 7 priests carrying 7 ram's horn trumpets will march in front of the ark. On the 7th day, march around the city 7 times while the priests blow the trumpets.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that when they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, and when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; and the wall of the city shall fall down flat, and the people shall ascend up every man straight before him.
verses.web: It shall be that when they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, and when you hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; and the city wall shall fall down flat, and the people shall go up, every man straight in front of him.”
verses.ct: When you hear one long blast from the ram's horn, the entire army must let out a massive shout. The city wall will collapse right where it stands, and every soldier will charge straight ahead into the city."

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said unto them, Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the LORD.
verses.web: Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said to them, “Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before LORD’s ark.”
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun called the priests and told them, "Pick up the ark of the covenant, and have 7 priests carry 7 ram's horn trumpets in front of the LORD's ark."

verses.kjv: And he said unto the people, Pass on, and compass the city, and let him that is armed pass on before the ark of the LORD.
verses.web: They said to the people, “Advance! March around the city, and let the armed men pass on before LORD’s ark.”
verses.ct: Then he told the people, "Move out! March around the city, and let the armed men go ahead of the LORD's ark."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joshua had spoken unto the people, that the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns passed on before the LORD, and blew with the trumpets: and the ark of the covenant of the LORD followed them.
verses.web: It was so, that when Joshua had spoken to the people, the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before LORD advanced and blew the trumpets, and the ark of LORD’s covenant followed them.
verses.ct: After Joshua gave these orders, the 7 priests carrying the 7 ram's horn trumpets marched ahead of the LORD, blowing the trumpets, and the ark of the covenant of the LORD followed behind them.

verses.kjv: And the armed men went before the priests that blew with the trumpets, and the rereward came after the ark, the priests going on, and blowing with the trumpets.
verses.web: The armed men went before the priests who blew the trumpets, and the ark went after them. The trumpets sounded as they went.
verses.ct: The armed men marched in front of the priests who blew the trumpets, and a rear guard followed behind the ark, with the trumpets sounding the whole time.

verses.kjv: And Joshua had commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor make any noise with your voice, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth, until the day I bid you shout; then shall ye shout.
verses.web: Joshua commanded the people, saying, “You shall not shout nor let your voice be heard, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth until the day I tell you to shout. Then you shall shout.”
verses.ct: Joshua had given the people strict orders: "Don't shout. Don't make a sound. Don't let a single word come out of your mouth until the day I tell you to shout. Then you'll shout."

verses.kjv: So the ark of the LORD compassed the city, going about it once: and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.
verses.web: So he caused LORD’s ark to go around the city, circling it once. Then they came into the camp, and stayed in the camp.
verses.ct: So the ark of the LORD circled the city once, and then they returned to camp and spent the night there.

verses.kjv: And Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of the LORD.
verses.web: Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up LORD’s ark.
verses.ct: Joshua got up early the next morning, and the priests picked up the LORD's ark.

verses.kjv: And seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the LORD went on continually, and blew with the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; but the rereward came after the ark of the LORD, the priests going on, and blowing with the trumpets.
verses.web: The seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns in front of LORD’s ark went on continually, and blew the trumpets. The armed men went in front of them. The rear guard came after LORD’s ark. The trumpets sounded as they went.
verses.ct: The 7 priests carrying the 7 ram's horn trumpets marched steadily in front of the LORD's ark, blowing the trumpets as they went. The armed men marched ahead of them, and the rear guard followed behind the LORD's ark, with the trumpets sounding the entire time.

verses.kjv: And the second day they compassed the city once, and returned into the camp: so they did six days.
verses.web: The second day they marched around the city once, and returned into the camp. They did this six days.
verses.ct: On the 2nd day, they marched around the city once and returned to camp. They did this for 6 days.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early about the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on that day they compassed the city seven times.
verses.web: On the seventh day, they rose early at the dawning of the day, and marched around the city in the same way seven times. On this day only they marched around the city seven times.
verses.ct: On the 7th day, they got up at dawn and marched around the city the same way — but this time they circled it 7 times. That was the only day they marched around it 7 times.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priests blew with the trumpets, Joshua said unto the people, Shout; for the LORD hath given you the city.
verses.web: At the seventh time, when the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua said to the people, “Shout, for LORD has given you the city!
verses.ct: On the 7th time around, as the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua shouted to the people, "Now shout! The LORD has given you the city!

verses.kjv: And the city shall be accursed, even it, and all that are therein, to the LORD: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all that are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
verses.web: The city shall be devoted, even it and all that is in it, to LORD. Only Rahab the prostitute shall live, she and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
verses.ct: The city and everything in it is to be completely devoted to the LORD for destruction. Only Rahab the prostitute and everyone in her house will be spared, because she hid the spies we sent.

verses.kjv: And ye, in any wise keep yourselves from the accursed thing, lest ye make yourselves accursed, when ye take of the accursed thing, and make the camp of Israel a curse, and trouble it.
verses.web: But as for you, only keep yourselves from what is devoted to destruction, lest when you have devoted it, you take of the devoted thing; so you would make the camp of Israel accursed and trouble it.
verses.ct: But stay away from the things set apart for destruction. If you take any of them, you'll bring a curse down on the entire camp of Israel and cause disaster for everyone.

verses.kjv: But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated unto the LORD: they shall come into the treasury of the LORD.
verses.web: But all the silver, gold, and vessels of bronze and iron are holy to LORD. They shall come into LORD’s treasury.”
verses.ct: All the silver, gold, and bronze and iron items are holy to the LORD. They must go into the LORD's treasury."

verses.kjv: So the people shouted when the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
verses.web: So the people shouted and the priests blew the trumpets. When the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight in front of him, and they took the city.
verses.ct: The priests blew the trumpets, and the people shouted. The moment they heard the trumpet blast and let out that massive shout, the wall collapsed flat to the ground. Every soldier charged straight ahead into the city, and they captured it.

verses.kjv: And they utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, young and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass, with the edge of the sword.
verses.web: They utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, both young and old, and ox, sheep, and donkey, with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: They destroyed everything in the city with the sword — men and women, young and old, cattle, sheep, and donkeys.

verses.kjv: But Joshua had said unto the two men that had spied out the country, Go into the harlot’s house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.
verses.web: Joshua said to the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into the prostitute’s house, and bring the woman and all that she has out from there, as you swore to her.”
verses.ct: Joshua told the 2 men who had scouted the land, "Go to the prostitute's house and bring her out with everyone she has, just as you swore you would."

verses.kjv: And the young men that were spies went in, and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she had; and they brought out all her kindred, and left them without the camp of Israel.
verses.web: The young men who were spies went in, and brought out Rahab with her father, her mother, her brothers, and all that she had. They also brought out all of her relatives, and they set them outside of the camp of Israel.
verses.ct: The young spies went in and brought out Rahab, along with her father, her mother, her brothers, and everything she had. They brought out her entire extended family and placed them in a safe area outside the Israelite camp.

verses.kjv: And they burnt the city with fire, and all that was therein: only the silver, and the gold, and the vessels of brass and of iron, they put into the treasury of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They burned the city with fire, and all that was in it. Only they put the silver, the gold, and the vessels of bronze and of iron into the treasury of LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Then they burned the entire city and everything in it. The only things they saved were the silver, gold, and bronze and iron items, which they placed in the treasury of the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: And Joshua saved Rahab the harlot alive, and her father’s household, and all that she had; and she dwelleth in Israel even unto this day; because she hid the messengers, which Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
verses.web: But Rahab the prostitute, her father’s household, and all that she had, Joshua saved alive. She lives in the middle of Israel to this day, because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
verses.ct: Joshua spared Rahab the prostitute, her father's household, and everyone with her. She has lived among the Israelites to this day, because she hid the spies that Joshua sent to scout out Jericho.

verses.kjv: And Joshua adjured them at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before the LORD, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: he shall lay the foundation thereof in his firstborn, and in his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it.
verses.web: Joshua commanded them with an oath at that time, saying, “Cursed is the man before LORD who rises up and builds this city Jericho. With the loss of his firstborn he will lay its foundation, and with the loss of his youngest son he will set up its gates.”
verses.ct: At that time, Joshua made the people swear a solemn oath: "Cursed before the LORD is anyone who rebuilds this city of Jericho. It will cost him his firstborn son to lay its foundation, and his youngest son to set up its gates."

verses.kjv: So the LORD was with Joshua; and his fame was noised throughout all the country.
verses.web: So LORD was with Joshua; and his fame was in all the land.
verses.ct: The LORD was with Joshua, and his fame spread throughout the entire land.
